intro: Tarchonanthus trilobus var. trilobus, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a small, evergreen shrub or tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. The wood of this plant is extremely hard and durable, which has made it valuable for traditional uses.
